title: 1. Thesis
stimulusHtml:
1 point
Has acceptable thesis.

• The thesis must include both a specific similarity and a specific difference in the effects of imperialism in two of the regions.

• The thesis must be explicitly stated in the introduction or conclusion of the essay.

• The thesis may appear as one sentence or as multiple consecutive sentences.

• A thesis that is split among multiple paragraphs is unacceptable.

• A thesis that merely restates the prompt is unacceptable.

• If the thesis is repeated/restated in the conclusion it may count for credit beyond the thesis.

• The thesis may NOT count for addressing the question or direct comparison.

title: 2. Addresses Question
stimulusHtml:

Addresses all parts of the question, though not necessarily evenly or thoroughly.

For 2 points:
• Essay addresses at least one specific similarity and one specific difference in the effects of imperialism in two regions within the time period.
• Essay discusses effects of imperialism in two regions but not necessarily evenly.

For 1 point:

• Essay addresses at least one specific similarity or one specific difference in the effects of imperialism in two regions within the time period.
• Essay discusses effects of imperialism in two regions but not necessarily evenly.

title: 3. Historical Evidence
stimulusHtml:
2 points
Substantiates thesis with appropriate historical evidence.

For 2 points:

• Essay provides a minimum of four pieces of accurate and relevant evidence within the time period.

• Essay includes at least two pieces of evidence from each region.

• Evidence must specifically address the effects of imperialism.

For 1 point:

• Essay provides a minimum of three pieces of accurate and relevant evidence within the time period.

• Essay includes at least one piece of evidence from each region.

• Evidence must specifically address the effects of imperialism.

title: 4. Direct Comparison
stimulusHtml:
1 point
Makes at least one direct, relevant comparison between the regions.

•The comparison must be made somewhere other than the thesis.

•The comparison must be a different one than the one(s) used to address a similarity

and a difference.

•The comparison may discuss either a similarity or a difference.

title: 6. Expanded Core
stimulusHtml:
0-2 points

Expands beyond basic core of 1–7 points. The basic core score of 7 must be achieved before a student can earn expanded core points.

Examples:

• Has a clear, analytical, and comprehensive thesis.

• Addresses all parts of the question thoroughly (as relevant): comparisons, chronology, causation, connections, themes, interactions, content.

• Provides ample historical evidence to substantiate thesis.

• Relates comparisons to larger global context.

• Makes several direct, relevant comparisons between or among regions.

• Consistently analyzes relevant similarities and differences.

• Applies relevant knowledge of other regions or world historical processes.

• Recognizes nuances within effects/ regions.
